definitions: (transitive) to treat (to handle, behave toward in a specific way)
(transitive) to treat (to submit to a chemical action)
(transitive) to address, to refer to as

(tratar de) to try, to attempt

Synonyms: intentar
(tratarse de, tratar de) to be about, to concern
description: tratar (first-person singular present trato, first-person singular preterite traté, past participle tratado)
etymology: Semi-learned borrowing from Latin tractāre, present active infinitive of tractō (“I drag; I handle; I practice”)[1], from tractus (“dragged”), perfect passive participle of trahō (“I drag; I extract”), from Proto-Indo-European *tragʰ- (“to draw, drag”). Cf. also the obsolete or regional inherited doublet  trechar (“to cut open and salt eels being dried and cured”). Cognate to Portuguese tratar.
